marlin.auber.common

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • marlin.auber.common.Entity

  • public class Entity
extends java.lang.Object

    An Entity is a container for components. The entity has no smarts itself, beyond keeping track of the components it has, the heavy lifting is done by components and systems.

    Note that currently Entity does not support more than one component of the same type. This may be changed in a future release.

    To create an entity, use create(java.lang.String, marlin.auber.common.Component...) with a unique ID and a set of components.

    To get an entity, use getEntityById(java.lang.String) if you know the ID or getAllEntitiesWithComponents(java.lang.Class<? extends marlin.auber.common.Component>...) with the components you want. To later get a component, use getComponent(java.lang.Class<T>).

    DO NOT HOLD REFERENCES TO ENTITIES OR COMPONENTS IN ANY OTHER PLACE! Otherwise, you run the risk of NullPointerExceptions as entities and components may come and go at any point in time.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static Entity create(java.lang.String id,
                            Component... components)
        Create a new entity with the given ID and components.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the new entity
        components - component instances to attach to it
        Returns:
        the new entity

      • attachComponent

        public void attachComponent(Component comp)
        Attach a component to this entity.
        Parameters:
        comp - the component to attach

      • removeComponent

        public void removeComponent(java.lang.Class<? extends Component> type)
        Removes a component from this entity. Once this is called, the component is considered destroyed and can be garbage collected.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of component to remove

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys this entity and all attached components.
        Once this method has been called, this entity will no longer appear in getAllEntitiesWithComponents(java.lang.Class<? extends marlin.auber.common.Component>...).

      • getComponent

        public <T extends Component> T getComponent(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Get a component of type T attached to this entity. May return null if a component of type T is not attached.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of component to retrieve
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class of T - should always be T.class
        Returns:
        the attached component, or null

      • hasComponent

        public boolean hasComponent(java.lang.Class<? extends Component> clazz)
        Does this entity have a component of type clazz
        Parameters:
        clazz - The type of component to check for
        Returns:
        whether a component of type clazz is attached

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()

      • getEntityById

        public static Entity getEntityById(java.lang.String id)
        Get an Entity, given its ID.
        Parameters:
        id - the entity ID
        Returns:
        the entity

      • getAllEntitiesWithComponents

        @SafeVarargs
public static java.util.List<Entity> getAllEntitiesWithComponents(java.lang.Class<? extends Component>... componentTypes)
        Returns all entities which have all the components in componentTypes attached. If this is called as List<Entity> e = Entity.getAllEntitiesWithComponents(X.class), one can assume that e.getComponent(X.class) will not be null.
        Parameters:
        componentTypes - the components to get
        Returns:
        all entities with attached components of type componentTypes
